events.title: A Growing City!
events.description:
Your city is growing quickly, and you're concerned about potential gridlock.
You have some options to address this:

options.title: Mass Transit
options.description: Benefits go beyond emissions reduction! Traffic congestion is reduced, fewer accidents occur, and air quality improves.

options.title: Ridesharing
options.description: Cheap gas and free parking compels people to travel alone. Incentivizing ridesharing may reduce the number of cars on the road.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: People don't like getting stuck in traffic! As the city continues to grow, developing transportation infrastructure will become more expensive.

events.title: Cold Weather
events.description:
In the winter, heating is a big source of energy draw. Solutions often increase energy efficiency in both the summer and the winter!
You can take action:

options.title: Insulation
options.description: Incentivizing insulation would prevent unwanted heat loss and gain, both in the winter and the summer!

options.title: District Heating
options.description: District Heating and Cooling (DHC) features a central plant to channel hot and cool water to many buildings. This enables thermal energy to be provided collectively and efficiently!

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: Your emissions from heating cooling will continue to increase as time goes on.

events.title: Waste Management
events.description: Insufficient efforts to promote recycling, composting, and other methods of waste diversion means your waste-processing facilities will soon be overwhelmed! To avoid disaster, you need to make a decision:

options.title: Waste-to-Energy
options.description: A transitional strategy for a world that wastes too much and needs to reduce its emissions, but would the public feel good with emitted heavy metals and toxic compounds?

options.title: Industrial Recycling
options.description: Make materials and goods recyclable, to reduce emissions from extracting, transporting, and processing raw materials.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: There is a high risk of pollution from the landfill site. The public will not be happy with that!

events.title: Extra Funds!
events.description: you are rewarded with a grant from the government for meeting environmental targets ahead of time. What are you going to do with this fund?

options.title: Solar Water
options.description: Solar water heating ¡ª exposing water to the sun to warm it ¡ª can reduce that fuel consumption by 50 to 70 percent.

options.title: Nuclear
options.description: Generating electricity from nuclear fission is very efficient in reducing carbon-dioxide emission, but safety and public acceptance are still the problem.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: You cannot save this fund for later use - do you really want to give it up?

events.title: New Buildings
events.description: With expansion of urban population, more residential and office spaces are needed. Do you want to improve any building regulation for new buildings?

options.title: Building Automation
options.description: Replace buildings with conventional pneumatic or electric control systems.

options.title: Insulation
options.description: Use improved materials in building envelopes that resist heat flow and regulate indoor temperatures.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: A large amount energy will be simply wasted!

events.title: PSA Opportunity!
events.description: There is a chance for you to promote energy conservation and environment protection in a public service advertisement on TV. What topic do you want to emphasize?

options.title: Reducing Food Waste
options.description: Producing uneaten food squanders a whole host of resources ¡ª let's avoid that!

options.title: Composting
options.description: Convert biodegradable waste to a useful soil amendment, while avoiding emissions from landfills.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: People will doubt your determination toward environment protection!

events.title: More Energy Source
events.description: Amount of energy generated by existing power stations will soon fall behind the population growth! Your city need a new energy source:

options.title: Methane Digesters
options.description: Make good use of organic waste! It can produce biogas for household heating.

options.title: Rooftop Solar
options.description: Households can now produce electricity using their own roodtop panels! Most importantly, it is both inexpensive and clean!

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: More energy is needed as the city grows! People do not like to throttle back their consumption at times of peak demand.

events.title: Industrial Energy Policy
events.description: According to the report, most of businesses in the city is still using non-renewable energy in their industrial production. It is now time to implement a policy asking them to use more renewable energy!

options.title: Onshore Wind Turbines
options.description: Take advantage of wind, with neither fuel cost nor pollution!

options.title: Concentrated Solar
options.description: Concentrate solar radiation on a small area. With energy storage, energy can also be used after dark!

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: Industrial pollution will be more serious! People do not like to wear masks all the time in winter!

events.title: Land Use
events.description: Do not forget that there was a bare area in the suburb! To make use of that area, your decision is:

options.title: Afforestation
options.description: Photosynthesis can absorb carbon-dioxide!

options.title: Solar Farms
options.description: Large amount of photovoltaic panels provide large amount of energy, making the costs negligible!

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: It still costs money to maintain that land!

events.title: Fund Shortage!
events.description: Research on green technology needs money! You need a way to raise funds.

options.title: Introduce Fuel Tax
options.description:: Introduce a new tax to account for environmental demages caused by the use of fuel.

options.title: Sell Energy
options.description: Sell surplus energy to other cities.

options.title: Do Nothing
options.description: Reduce the budget on the research.
